title: At the White House, Trump’s Grief and Shock Turn to Rage Over Charlie Kirk
summary: President Trump asked for updates and met with advisers in the Oval Office before recording a four-minute video in which he blamed rhetoric from the “radical left” for the killing.

title: Republicans Block Schumer’s Effort to Force Vote on Epstein Files
summary: Though it failed, Mr. Schumer’s proposal brought the contentious debate over the Trump administration’s handling of the Epstein files to the Senate, which has largely avoided it.

title: House Passes Defense Policy Bill With Transgender, Diversity Restrictions
summary: For the third year in a row, House Republicans pushed through a Pentagon policy measure that included conservative policy dictates.

title: Supreme Court Rules for Transgender Boy in Bathroom Dispute
summary: The interim order came after a decision in June on medical care for transgender youths and as the justices prepare to hear arguments on transgender athletes.

title: Kennedy Report Won’t Solve America’s Food Issues, Experts Say
summary: Food policy experts said the White House health report is full of promising ideas, but falls short in key ways.

title: Chronic Disease Deaths Have Fallen Globally, but Progress in U.S. Stalled
summary: Among younger American adults, death from chronic disease actually increased — a rarity among high-income countries, a new report shows.

title: New Jersey Is the Latest State to Expand Access to Updated Covid Shots
summary: Pharmacists will be allowed to give the latest vaccines to anyone over 3, rebuffing federal efforts to limit the number of those eligible.

title: Our Favorite Restaurants and Industry Trends of 2025
summary: What we’ve noticed, what we’d like to see more of and a few things we would rather see the end of.

title: Harvard Is Told Research Money Could Flow Again, for Now
summary: After a court victory, Harvard researchers were told some grants were being restored. But the battle over whether the government can halt the money is probably not over.

title: Texas Professor Fired After Accusations of Teaching ‘Gender Ideology’
summary: Two administrators also lost their posts at Texas A&M, an example of how Republican policies meant to curb liberal ideas are reaching into university classrooms.

title: Education Department Ends Grant Funding Worth $350 Million for Minority-Serving Colleges
summary: Education Secretary Linda McMahon said the money supported programs that the administration believes unfairly support minority students.

title: Shooting Suspect Is Dead After Attack at Colorado High School, Authorities Say
summary: A male suspect died of self-inflicted injuries after opening fire and critically injuring two students on the grounds of Evergreen High School in Evergreen, Colo.

title: CBS News Weighs Major Role for Bari Weiss as Part of Deal to Buy The Free Press
summary: The talks with Ms. Weiss, a founder of The Free Press, are the strongest sign yet that the new owner of CBS News intends to make major changes.

title: Happy 10th Birthday to the Laser Interferometer Gravitational-Wave Observatory. Now Drop Dead.
summary: Ten years ago, astronomers made an epic discovery with the Laser Interferometer Gravitational-Wave Observatory. Cosmology hasn’t been the same since, and it might not stay that way much longer.

title: Should Harris Have Told Biden Not to Run? ‘Perhaps,’ She Writes in New Book
summary: Former Vice President Kamala Harris also accused White House aides, without naming names, of not defending her from right-wing attacks about her competence.

title: After Qatar, Israel Fires on Yemen: ‘Whoever Attacks Us, We Will Reach Them’
summary: Israel’s military launched multiple attacks on Houthi sites in northern Yemen, a day after its widely criticized airstrike against Hamas officials on Qatari soil.

title: Mamdani Reflects on Life After 9/11 as a Muslim in New York City
summary: Ahead of the 24th anniversary of Sept. 11, Zohran Mamdani, the front-runner to be the city’s next mayor, spoke about the importance of honoring the victims and the persistent Islamophobia the attacks provoked.

title: I’d Be Thailand’s Leader Now if the System Wasn’t Rigged
summary: Unless its democratic decay is reversed, Thailand will continue to spiral downward until the next generation decides enough is enough.

title: Charlie Kirk’s Horrific Killing and America’s Worsening Political Violence
summary: This is a moment to turn down the volume and reflect on our political culture.

title: Police Arrest Suspect in Death of Queens Couple in Burning House
summary: The arrested man is Jamel McGriff, 42. Investigators believe he killed a couple in their 70s, one of whom was found tied to a pole.

title: Mexico City Gas Explosion Kills 3 and Injures at Least 70
summary: The cause of the enormous blast, which created chaos in one of the capital’s most heavily populated areas, was thought to be an accident.

title: Norton Says Little as Bills to Clamp Down on D.C. Advance
summary: At a heated committee session on bills exerting more federal control of Washington, the 88-year-old delegate sat quietly, reading with difficulty from a script.

title: Rosa Roisinblit, Who Championed the Missing in Argentina, Dies at 106
summary: She helped create the activist group Grandmothers of Plaza de Mayo, which sought to find relatives who had been killed or “disappeared” by the 1976-83 military dictatorship.
